alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monmouth and northeastern Middlesex Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Edison, or near New Brunswick, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerset, Edison, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Sayreville, Carteret, Keansburg, Matawan, Colonia, Brownville, Society Hill, North Brunswick Township, Woodbridge, South Plainfield, South River, Highland Park, Metuchen and Spotswood. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 13. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8, and near mile marker 10. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 118 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and central New Jersey.
